data.title: Finding articles in older Alaskan newspapers
data.meta_description: A description of printed indexes and online searching available for Alaska's historical newspapers.
data.text:
There are many more newspapers that were published in Alaska and elsewhere than were either indexed or digitized. Microfilmed issues of other newspapers are held in many libraries across the country.

The Library of Congress has published a comprehensive finding guide to newspapers held in US library collections. It is called the Directory of U.S. Newspapers in American Libraries. According to the Library of Congress:

"The Directory of U.S. Newspapers in American Libraries is a searchable index of newspapers published in the United States since 1690. This directory can help identify what titles exist for a specific place and time, and how to access them. The Library of Congress does not hold all titles included in this Directory."

The Alaska State Library holds and has produced indexing resources for historical Alaska newspapers. This resource is intended to list these resources, along with other free, publicly available indexes and Alaskan newspaper archives. We're not linking to resources requiring a paid subscription.

If you don’t see your community listed below, try searching the Alaska Library Catalog with [(community name) newspapers indexes]. Indexes may be available at other libraries for check-out and inter-library loan.

The printed indexes are available in the Ready/Genealogy section of the Reading Richard Foster Room of the Alaska State Library and/or in the Research Center or in the Historical Collections vault as noted. Click on the title of a print index to see its catalog record as some indexes are available in other libraries in Alaska.

This finding guide is arranged by community. Digital resources are noted first, then printed indexes are listed below in bold letters and are followed by the newspaper titles indexed within each if not mentioned in the title.

DIGITAL RESOURCES

Alaska Historical Newspapers on Chronicling America (full text keyword search)

The Alaska State Library participates in the National Digital Newspaper Program, which posts digitized newspapers on Chronicling America. As of June 2023, there were 127 Alaskan newspapers with content on this site.

Currently digitized newspapers can be searched separately or as a group by keyword or browsed by issue by visiting Chronicling America or by scanning the QR code below with your phone or tablet:

Alaska Newspapers Index (citation only keyword search)

The Alaska Newspapers Index is a searchable database. It provides citation access to the following newspapers in Juneau, Fairbanks (searchable as a group), Tanana (searchable as a group), and Yukon:

Alaska Citizen - 4/1912-1/1920

Chena Herald - 6/1904-9/1905

Fairbanks Daily News - 11/1904-5/1975

Fairbanks Daily News Miner - 3/23/1909

Fairbanks Daily Times - 7/1904-12/1916

Fairbanks Weekly News - 9/1903-5/1908

Hot Springs Echo - 4/1907-10/1912

Juneau Empire - 12/1990-8/1999

Nenana News - 9/1916-5/1972

Northern Light - 2/1906-9/1907

Rampart Miner - 9/1901-8/1902

Tanana Daily Miner - 8/12/1906

Tanana Daily Star - 7/1910-4/1915

Tanana Leader - 7/1909-8/1910

Tanana Tribune - 9/1907-9/1909

Yukon Press - 11/1905-3/1906
